subject: Communication
title: The Birth of Rhetoric in Ancient Greece
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Birth of Rhetoric in Ancient Greece.

hook.text: In 5th-century Athens, your power wasn't just wealth or weapons â€” it was your ability to speak.

buildup.text: Athenian democracy required citizens to argue their own cases in court and vote on policy in person.

discovery.text: Corax and Tisias wrote the first known handbook on persuasive speech around 460 BCE.

twist.text: Rhetoric wasn't just art â€” it was survival. Lose an argument in court, lose your property or life.

climax.text: This pressure forged rhetoric into a discipline as rigorous as mathematics or philosophy.

punchline.text: Democracy didn't just need voters. It needed speakers.

quiz.question: Where did the formal study of rhetoric originate?
